name: NSDraggingDestination
desc: A set of methods that the destination object (or recipient) of a dragged image must implement.

items.name: func draggingEntered(NSDraggingInfo) -> NSDragOperation
items.desc: Invoked when the dragged image enters destination bounds or frame; delegate returns dragging operation to perform.

items.name: func wantsPeriodicDraggingUpdates() -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the destination object whether it wants to receive periodic draggingUpdated(_:) messages.

items.name: func draggingUpdated(NSDraggingInfo) -> NSDragOperation
items.desc: Invoked periodically as the image is held within the destination area, allowing modification of the dragging operation or mouse-pointer position.

items.name: func draggingEnded(NSDraggingInfo)
items.desc: Called when a drag operation ends.

items.name: func draggingExited(NSDraggingInfo?)
items.desc: Invoked when the dragged image exits the destinationâ€™s bounds rectangle (in the case of a view object) or its frame rectangle (in the case of a window object).

items.name: func prepareForDragOperation(NSDraggingInfo) -> Bool
items.desc: Invoked when the image is released, allowing the receiver to agree to or refuse drag operation.

items.name: func performDragOperation(NSDraggingInfo) -> Bool
items.desc: Invoked after the released image has been removed from the screen, signaling the receiver to import the pasteboard data.

items.name: func concludeDragOperation(NSDraggingInfo?)
items.desc: Invoked when the dragging operation is complete, signaling the receiver to perform any necessary clean-up.

items.name: func updateDraggingItemsForDrag(NSDraggingInfo?)
items.desc: Invoked when the dragging images should be changed.
